title: How many cubic meters of polar ice have we humans caused to melt? - Quora

response.answer_text: It doesn’t make sense to measure ice melt in square meters (cubic meters perhaps). Essentially this is an attribution problem. Data suggests that ice loss has accelerated by at least a factor of six since the 1970s. Assuming that all that additional ice loss can be attributed to human-caused climate change then the order of magnitude would be around 7.5 trillion tonnes, so roughly 8 trillion cubic meters. An ice cube 20km x 20km x 20km.

It’s probably a few m^2 for the coring, and a larger number for the volume, since some cores were quite long. What’s taken out as a core is of course still solid, but the cutting process melted some at the perimeter. I have no idea how long the cores are stored frozen.
